Command.name: addhostiogrp
Command.description: The addhostiogrp command enables you to map I/O groups to an existing host object.

Command.name: addhostport
Command.description: The addhostport command adds worldwide port names (WWPNs) or iSCSI names to an existing host object.

Command.name: addmdisk
Command.description: The addmdisk command adds one or more managed disks to an existing managed disk group.

Command.name: addnode
Command.description: You can use the addnode command to add a new (candidate) node to an existing cluster. You can enter this command any time after a cluster has been created. If you are adding a new node to a cluster, you must ensure that the model type of the new node is supported by the SAN Volume Controller software version of the cluster. If the model type is not supported by the cluster software, you must upgrade the cluster to a software version that supports the model type of the new node.

Command.name: addvdiskcopy
Command.description: The addvdiskcopy command adds a copy to an existing VDisk, which changes a nonmirrored VDisk into a mirrored VDisk. Note: The first syntax diagram depicts the addition of a sequential or striped mode virtual disk. The second syntax diagram depicts the addition of an image mode virtual disk.

Command.name: applymdisksoftware
Command.description: Use the applymdisksoftware command to upgrade the firmware on a specified managed disk (MDisk). Only solid-state drives (SSDs) can be specified.

Command.name: applysoftware
Command.description: The applysoftware command upgrades the cluster to a new level of software.

Command.name: cfgportip
Command.description: The cfgportip command assigns an IP address to each node ethernet port for iSCSI I/O.

Command.name: chauthservice
Command.description: The chauthservice command can be used to configure the remote authentication service of the cluster.

Command.name: chcluster
Command.description: The chcluster command modifies the attributes of an existing cluster. You can enter this command any time after a cluster has been created. All the parameters that are associated with this command are optional. However, you must specify one or more parameters with this command.

Command.name: chclusterip
Command.description: The chclusterip command modifies the IP configuration parameters for the cluster.

Command.name: chcontroller
Command.description: The chcontroller command modifies the attributes of a controller.

Command.name: chcurrentuser
Command.description: The chcurrentuser command changes the attributes of the current user.

Command.name: chemail
Command.description: The chemail command can be used to set or modify contact information for e-mail event notifications. To modify settings, at least one of the parameters must be specified.

Command.name: chemailserver
Command.description: The chemailserver command modifies the parameters of an existing e-mail server object.

Command.name: chemailuser
Command.description: The chemailuser command modifies the settings that are defined for an e-mail recipient.

Command.name: cherrstate
Command.description: The cherrstate command marks an unfixed error as fixed. You can also use it to mark a fixed error as unfixed.

Command.name: chfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The chfcconsistgrp command changes the name of a consistency group or marks the group for auto-deletion.

Command.name: chfcmap
Command.description: The chfcmap command modifies attributes of an existing mapping.

Command.name: chhost
Command.description: The chhost command changes the name or type of a host object. This does not affect any existing virtual disk-to-host mappings.

Command.name: chiogrp
Command.description: The chiogrp command modifies the name of an I/O group, or the amount of memory that is available for Copy Services or VDisk mirroring operations.

Command.name: chlicense
Command.description: The chlicense command changes license settings for cluster features.

Command.name: chmdisk
Command.description: Use the chmdisk command to modify the name of a managed disk (MDisk).

Command.name: chmdiskgrp
Command.description: Use the chmdiskgrp command to modify the name that is assigned to a managed disk (MDisk) group or to set the warning threshold for the MDisk group.

Command.name: chnode
Command.description: You can use the chnode command to change the name that is assigned to a node and other options. The name can then be used when running subsequent commands. All the parameters that are associated with this command are optional. However, you must specify one or more parameters with this command.

Command.name: chpartnership
Command.description: The chpartnership command modifies the bandwidth of the partnership between the local cluster and the remote cluster that is specified in the command. This affects the bandwidth that is available for background copy in a cluster partnership by either Metro Mirror or Global Mirror operations. This command can also be used to disable and re-enable the partnership, to permit the local cluster to be disconnected and then reconnected to the remote cluster.

Command.name: chrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The chrcconsistgrp command modifies the name of an existing Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group.

Command.name: chrcrelationship
Command.description: The chrcrelationship command enables you to modify certain attributes of an existing relationship, such as to add a relationship to a consistency group, to remove a relationship from a consistency group, and to change the name of the relationship. You can only change one attribute at a time per command submittal.

Command.name: chsnmpserver
Command.description: The chsnmpserver command modifies the parameters of an existing SNMP server.

Command.name: chsyslogserver
Command.description: The chsyslogserver command modifies the parameters of an existing syslog server.

Command.name: chuser
Command.description: The chuser command changes the attributes of an existing user.

Command.name: chusergrp
Command.description: The chusergrp command changes the attributes of an existing user group.

Command.name: chvdisk
Command.description: The chvdisk command modifies the properties of a VDisk (volume), such as the disk name, I/O group, I/O governing rate, or unit number.

Command.name: cleardumps
Command.description: The cleardumps command cleans the various dump directories on a specified node.

Command.name: clearerrlog
Command.description: The clearerrlog command clears all entries from the error log including status events and any unfixed errors.

Command.name: cpdumps
Command.description: The cpdumps command copies dump files from a nonconfiguration node onto the configuration node. Note: In the rare event that the /dumps directory on the configuration node is full, the copy action ends when the directory is full and provides no indicator of a failure. Therefore, clear the /dumps directory after migrating data from the configuration node.

Command.name: detectmdisk
Command.description: The detectmdisk command allows you to manually rescan the fibre-channel network for any new managed disks (MDisks) that might have been added and to rebalance MDisk access across all available controller device ports.

Command.name: dumpauditlog
Command.description: Use the dumpauditlog command to reset or clear the contents of the in-memory audit log. The contents of the audit log are sent to a file in the /dumps/audit directory on the current configuration node.

Command.name: dumperrlog
Command.description: The dumperrlog command dumps the contents of the error log to a text file.

Command.name: dumpinternallog
Command.description: The dumpinternallog command dumps the contents of the license settings error and event log to a file on the current configuration node.

Command.name: enablecli
Command.description: Use the enablecli command to fully enable the CLI for a cluster that has been through a cluster recovery process.

Command.name: expandvdisksize
Command.description: The expandvdisksize command expands the size of a VDisk by a given capacity.

Command.name: finderr
Command.description: The finderr command analyzes the error log for the highest severity unfixed error.

Command.name: includemdisk
Command.description: Use the includemdisk command to include a disk that has been excluded by the cluster.

Command.name: migrateexts
Command.description: The migrateexts command migrates extents from one managed disk to another.

Command.name: migratetoimage
Command.description: The migratetoimage command migrates data from a VDisk (image mode or managed mode) onto a new image mode VDisk copy. The target disk does not have to be in the same MDisk group as the source disk.

Command.name: migratevdisk
Command.description: The migratevdisk command enables you to migrate an entire virtual disk from one managed disk group to another managed disk group.

Command.name: mkemailserver
Command.description: The mkemailserver command creates an e-mail server object that describes a remote Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) e-mail server.

Command.name: mkemailuser
Command.description: The mkemailuser command adds a recipient of e-mail event and inventory notifications to the e-mail event notification facility. You can add up to twelve recipients, one recipient at a time.

Command.name: mkfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The mkfcconsistgrp command creates a new FlashCopy consistency group and identification name.

Command.name: mkfcmap
Command.description: The mkfcmap command creates a new FlashCopy mapping, which maps a source VDisk to a target VDisk for subsequent copying.

Command.name: mkhost
Command.description: The mkhost command creates a logical host object.

Command.name: mkmdiskgrp
Command.description: The mkmdiskgrp command creates a new managed disk group (storage pool).

Command.name: mkpartnership
Command.description: The mkpartnership command establishes a one-way Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship between the local cluster and a remote cluster.

Command.name: mkrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The mkrcconsistgrp command creates a new, empty Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group. If the -cluster parameter is not specified, the consistency group is created on the local cluster only.

Command.name: mkrcrelationship
Command.description: The mkrcrelationship command creates a new Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship with virtual disks (VDisks) in the same cluster (intracluster relationship) or in two different clusters (intercluster relationship).

Command.name: mksnmpserver
Command.description: The mksnmpserver command creates an SNMP server to receive notifications.

Command.name: mksyslogserver
Command.description: The mksyslogserver command creates a syslog server to receive notifications.

Command.name: mkuser
Command.description: The mkuser command creates either a local or a remote user to access a SAN Volume Controller cluster.

Command.name: mkusergrp
Command.description: The mkusergrp command creates a new user group.

Command.name: mkvdisk
Command.description: The mkvdisk command creates sequential, striped, or image mode virtual disk (volume) objects. When they are mapped to a host object, these objects are seen as disk drives with which the host can perform I/O operations. Note: The first syntax diagram depicts the creation of a striped mode virtual disk. The second syntax diagram depicts the creation of a sequential or image mode virtual disk.

Command.name: mkvdiskhostmap
Command.description: The mkvdiskhostmap command creates a new mapping between a virtual disk and a host, which makes the virtual disk accessible for I/O operations to the specified host.

Command.name: ping
Command.description: The ping command can be used to diagnose IP configuration problems by checking whether the specified IP address is accessible from the configuration node.

Command.name: prestartfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The prestartfcconsistgrp command prepares a consistency group (a group of FlashCopy mappings) so that the consistency group can be started. This command flushes the cache of any data that is destined for the source VDisk and forces the cache into the write-through mode until the consistency group is started.

Command.name: prestartfcmap
Command.description: The prestartfcmap command prepares a FlashCopy mapping so that it can be started. This command flushes the cache of any data that is destined for the source VDisk and forces the cache into the write-through mode until the mapping is started.

Command.name: recovervdisk
Command.description: The recovervdisk command acknowledges VDisk data loss and brings the VDisk back online.

Command.name: recovervdiskbycluster
Command.description: The recovervdiskbycluster command acknowledges data loss for all VDisks in the cluster with a fast_write_state of corrupt and brings the VDisks back online.

Command.name: recovervdiskbyiogrp
Command.description: The recovervdiskbyiogrp command acknowledges data loss for all VDisks in the specified I/O group with a fast_write_state of corrupt and brings the VDisks back online.

Command.name: repairsevdiskcopy
Command.description: The repairsevdiskcopy command repairs the metadata on a space-efficient virtual disk.

Command.name: repairvdiskcopy
Command.description: The repairvdiskcopy command detects and optionally, corrects any VDisk (volume) copies that are not identical.

Command.name: resetleds
Command.description: Use the resetleds command to simultaneously switch off all LEDs in the cluster.

Command.name: rmemailserver
Command.description: The rmemailserver command deletes the specified e-mail server object.

Command.name: rmemailuser
Command.description: The rmemailuser command allows you to remove a previously defined e-mail recipient from your system.

Command.name: rmfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The rmfcconsistgrp command deletes a FlashCopy consistency group.

Command.name: rmfcmap
Command.description: The rmfcmap command deletes an existing mapping.

Command.name: rmhost
Command.description: The rmhost command deletes a host object.

Command.name: rmhostiogrp
Command.description: The rmhostiogrp command enables you to delete mappings between one or more I/O groups and a specified host object.

Command.name: rmhostport
Command.description: The rmhostport command deletes worldwide port names (WWPNs) or iSCSI names from an existing host object.

Command.name: rmmdisk
Command.description: The rmmdisk command deletes a managed disk (MDisk) from a managed disk group.

Command.name: rmmdiskgrp
Command.description: The rmmdiskgrp command deletes a managed disk group so that there is no possibility to recover it.

Command.name: rmnode
Command.description: The rmnode command deletes a node from the cluster. You can enter this command any time after a cluster has been created.

Command.name: rmpartnership
Command.description: The rmpartnership command removes a Metro Mirror or Global Mirror partnership on one cluster. Because the partnership exists on both clusters, it is necessary to run this command on both clusters to remove both sides of the partnership. If the command is run on only one cluster, the partnership enters a partially configured state on the other cluster.

Command.name: rmportip
Command.description: The rmportip command removes an iSCSI IP address from a node ethernet port.

Command.name: rmrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The rmrcconsistgrp command deletes an existing Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group.

Command.name: rmrcrelationship
Command.description: The rmrcrelationship command deletes an existing Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship.

Command.name: rmsnmpserver
Command.description: The rmsnmpserver command deletes the specified SNMP server.

Command.name: rmsyslogserver
Command.description: The rmsyslogserver command deletes the specified syslog server.

Command.name: rmuser
Command.description: The rmuser command deletes a user.

Command.name: rmusergrp
Command.description: The rmusergrp command deletes a user group.

Command.name: rmvdisk
Command.description: The rmvdisk command deletes a virtual disk (VDisk).

Command.name: rmvdiskcopy
Command.description: The rmvdiskcopy command removes a VDisk copy from a VDisk.

Command.name: rmvdiskhostmap
Command.description: The rmvdiskhostmap command deletes an existing virtual disk-to-host mapping; the virtual disk is no longer accessible for I/O transactions on the given host.

Command.name: sendinventoryemail
Command.description: The sendinventoryemail command sends an inventory e-mail notification to all e-mail recipients who are enabled to receive inventory e-mail notifications. There are no parameters for this command.

Command.name: setclustertime
Command.description: The setclustertime command allows you to set the time for the cluster.

Command.name: setdisktrace
Command.description: Use the setdisktrace command to set a list of disks of a given type, to include in a disk trace.

Command.name: setlocale
Command.description: The setlocale command changes the locale setting for the cluster. It also changes command output to the chosen language.

Command.name: setpwdreset
Command.description: Use the setpwdreset command to view and change the status of the password-reset feature for the display panel.

Command.name: setquorum
Command.description: Use the setquorum command to change the managed disks (MDisks) that are assigned as quorum candidate disks.

Command.name: settimezone
Command.description: Use the settimezone command to set the time zone for the cluster.

Command.name: settrace
Command.description: The settrace command sets options to trace certain I/O operations through the system.

Command.name: shrinkvdisksize
Command.description: The shrinkvdisksize command reduces the size of a VDisk by the specified capacity.

Command.name: splitvdiskcopy
Command.description: The splitvdiskcopy command creates a separate VDisk from a synchronized copy of a mirrored VDisk.

Command.name: startemail
Command.description: The startemail command activates the e-mail and inventory notification function. There are no parameters for this command.

Command.name: startfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The startfcconsistgrp command starts a FlashCopy consistency group of mappings. This command makes a point-in-time copy of the source VDisks at the moment that the command is started.

Command.name: startfcmap
Command.description: The startfcmap command starts a FlashCopy mapping. This command makes a point-in-time copy of the source VDisk at the moment that the command is started.

Command.name: startrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The startrcconsistgrp command starts the Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group copy process, sets the direction of copy if it is undefined, and optionally marks the secondary VDisks of the consistency group as clean.

Command.name: startrcrelationship
Command.description: The startrcrelationship command starts the Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship copy process, sets the direction of copy if undefined, and optionally, marks the secondary VDisk of the relationship as clean. The relationship must be a stand-alone relationship.

Command.name: startstats
Command.description: Use the startstats command to modify the interval at which per-node statistics for virtual disks (VDisks), managed disks (MDisks), and nodes are collected.

Command.name: starttrace
Command.description: Use the starttrace command to begin tracing I/O operations that are based on the option currently set for the specified object type and the list of disks to trace.

Command.name: stopcluster
Command.description: The stopcluster command allows you to shut down a single node or the entire cluster in a controlled manner. When you issue this command, you are prompted with a confirmation of intent to process the command.

Command.name: stopemail
Command.description: The stopemail command stops the e-mail and inventory notification function. There are no parameters for this command.

Command.name: stopfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The stopfcconsistgrp command stops all processing that is associated with a FlashCopy consistency group that is in one of the following processing states: prepared, copying, stopping, or suspended.

Command.name: stopfcmap
Command.description: The stopfcmap command stops all processing that is associated with a FlashCopy mapping that is in one of the following processing states: prepared, copying, stopping, or suspended.

Command.name: stoprcconsistgrp
Command.description: The stoprcconsistgrp command stops the copy process for a Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group. This command can also be used to enable write access to the secondary VDisks in the group if the group is in a consistent state.

Command.name: stoprcrelationship
Command.description: The stoprcrelationship command stops the copy process for a Metro Mirror or Global Mirror stand-alone relationship. You can also use this command to enable write access to a consistent secondary VDisk.

Command.name: stopstats
Command.description: Use the stopstats command to stop the collection of per-node statistics for virtual disks (VDisks), managed disks (MDisks), and nodes.

Command.name: stoptrace
Command.description: Use the stoptrace command to stop tracing operations for the specified disk type.

Command.name: switchrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The switchrcconsistgrp command reverses the roles of the primary and secondary virtual disks (VDisks) in a Metro Mirror or Global Mirror consistency group when that consistency group is in a consistent state. All the relationships in the consistency group are affected by this change.

Command.name: switchrcrelationship
Command.description: The switchrcrelationship command reverses the roles of primary and secondary virtual disks in a stand-alone Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship when that relationship is in a consistent state.

Command.name: testemail
Command.description: The testemail command allows you to send an e-mail notification to one user of the e-mail notification function or to all users of the e-mail notification function to ensure that the function is operating correctly.

Command.name: triggermdiskdump
Command.description: Use the triggermdiskdump command to collect error data from the specified managed disk (MDisk). Only solid-state drives (SSDs) can be specified.

Command.name: writesernum
Command.description: Use the writesernum command to write the node serial number into the planar NVRAM.

Command.name: catauditlog
Command.description: Use the catauditlog command to display the in-memory contents of the audit log.

Command.name: caterrlog
Command.description: The caterrlog command displays the contents of the cluster error log and event log.

Command.name: caterrlogbyseqnum
Command.description: The caterrlogbyseqnum command displays all the errors with the sequence number or root cause number that has been specified by the user.

Command.name: ls2145dumps
Command.description: Use the ls2145dumps command to display a list of error conditions detected by a node, and the associated output files from the /dumps directory.

Command.name: lsauditlogdumps
Command.description: The lsauditlogdumps command generates a list of the audit log dumps that are available on the nodes in the cluster.

Command.name: lscimomdumps
Command.description: Use the lscimomdumps command to display a list of files in the /dumps/cimom directory.

Command.name: lscluster
Command.description: The lscluster command returns a concise list or a detailed view of a cluster.

Command.name: lsclustercandidate
Command.description: The lsclustercandidate command lists the clusters that are available for setting up a partnership with the local cluster. This is a prerequisite for creating intercluster Metro or Global Mirror relationships.

Command.name: lsclusterip
Command.description: The lsclusterip command returns a list of the cluster management IP addresses configured for each port.

Command.name: lscontroller
Command.description: The lscontroller command returns a concise list, or a detailed view, of controllers that are visible to the cluster.

Command.name: lscontrollerdependentvdisks
Command.description: The lscontrollerdependentvdisks command lists the VDisks that are dependent on the specified controller.

Command.name: lscopystatus
Command.description: Use the lscopystatus command to determine whether any file copies are currently in progress.

Command.name: lscurrentuser
Command.description: Use the lscurrentuser command to display the name and role of the logged-in user.

Command.name: lsdiscoverystatus
Command.description: Use the lsdiscoverystatus command to determine whether a discovery operation is in progress.

Command.name: lsemailserver
Command.description: The lsemailserver command returns a concise list or a detailed view of e-mail servers that are configured on the cluster.

Command.name: lsemailuser
Command.description: The lsemailuser command generates a report that lists the e-mail event notification settings for all e-mail recipients, an individual e-mail recipient, or a specified type (local or support) of e-mail recipient.

Command.name: lserrlogbyfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The lserrlogbyfcconsistgrp command displays errors and events in the log that are related to FlashCopy consistency groups.

Command.name: lserrlogbyfcmap
Command.description: The lserrlogbyfcmap command displays a list of the errors and events in the log that are related to FlashCopy mappings.

Command.name: lserrlogbyhost
Command.description: The lserrlogbyhost command displays a list of the errors and events in the log that are related to hosts.

Command.name: lserrlogbyiogrp
Command.description: The lserrlogbyiogrp command displays a list of the errors and events in the log that are related to I/O groups.

Command.name: lserrlogbymdisk
Command.description: The lserrlogbymdisk command displays a list of the errors and events in the log that are related to a specific MDisk.

Command.name: lserrlogbymdiskgrp
Command.description: lserrlogbymdiskgrp You can use the lserrlogbymdiskgroup command to display the error log by MDisk group.

Command.name: lserrlogbynode
Command.description: The lserrlogbynode command displays a list of the errors and events in the log that are related to nodes.

Command.name: lserrlogbyrcconsistgrp
Command.description: You can use the lserrlogbyrcconsistgrp command to display the error log by Metro or Global Mirror consistency groups.

Command.name: lserrlogbyrcrelationship
Command.description: The lserrlogbyrcrelationship command displays a list of the errors and events in the log by Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationships.

Command.name: lserrlogbyvdisk
Command.description: The lserrlogbyvdisk command displays a list of the errors and events in the log by VDisks.

Command.name: lserrlogdumps
Command.description: The lserrlogdumps command displays a list of error log dumps in the /dumps/elogs directory. These dumps are created as a result of the svctask dumperrlog command.

Command.name: lsfabric
Command.description: The lsfabric command generates a report that displays the fibre-channel connectivity between nodes, controllers and hosts.

Command.name: lsfcconsistgrp
Command.description: The lsfcconsistgrp command returns a concise list or a detailed view of FlashCopy consistency groups that are visible to the cluster. This information is useful for tracking FlashCopy consistency groups. The list report style can be used to obtain two styles of report: * A list containing concise information about all of the FlashCopy consistency groups on a cluster. (Each entry in the list corresponds to a single FlashCopy consistency group.) * The detailed information about a single FlashCopy consistency group.

Command.name: lsfcmap
Command.description: The lsfcmap command generates a list containing concise information about all of the FlashCopy mappings that are visible to the cluster, or detailed information for a single FlashCopy mapping.

Command.name: lsfcmapcandidate
Command.description: The lsfcmapcandidate command lists all of the VDisks that are associated with fewer than 256 FlashCopy mappings.

Command.name: lsfcmapdependentmaps
Command.description: The lsfcmapdependentmaps command displays all the FlashCopy mappings that are dependent on the user specified mapping.

Command.name: lsfcmapprogress
Command.description: The lsfcmapprogress command returns the progress of the background copy of a FlashCopy mapping. This is displayed as a percentage completed value.

Command.name: lsfeaturedumps
Command.description: The lsfeaturedumps command displays a list of dump files in the /dumps/feature directory. These dump files are created as a result of the svctask dumpinternallog command.

Command.name: lsfreeextents
Command.description: The lsfreeextents command lists the number of free extents that are available on a specified MDisk.

Command.name: lshbaportcandidate
Command.description: The lshbaportcandidate command lists all of the unconfigured, logged-in host bus adapter (HBA) ports. This information is used to find open HBA ports.

Command.name: lshost
Command.description: The lshost command generates a list with concise information about all the hosts visible to the cluster and detailed information about a single host.

Command.name: lshostiogrp
Command.description: The lshostiogrp command displays a list of all the I/O groups that are associated with a specified host.

Command.name: lshostvdiskmap
Command.description: The lshostvdiskmap command displays a list of VDisks that are mapped to a given host. These are the VDisks that are recognized by the specified host.

Command.name: lsiogrp
Command.description: The lsiogrp command returns a concise list or a detailed view of I/O groups visible to the cluster. The list report style can be used to obtain the following two styles of report: * A list containing concise information about all the I/O groups that are visible to the cluster. Each entry in the list corresponds to a single I/O group. * The detailed information about a single I/O group.

Command.name: lsiogrpcandidate
Command.description: Use the lsiogrpcandidate command to list the I/O groups that can have nodes added to them.

Command.name: lsiogrphost
Command.description: The lsiogrphost command displays a list of the hosts that are mapped to a specified I/O group.

Command.name: lsiostatsdumps
Command.description: The lsiostatsdumps command displays a list of dumps in the /dumps/iostats directory. Use the svctask startstats command to create these dumps.

Command.name: lsiotracedumps
Command.description: Use the lsiotracedumps command to display a list of files in the /dumps/iotrace directory.

Command.name: lsiscsiauth
Command.description: The lsiscsiauth command lists the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP) secret configured for authenticating an entity to the SAN Volume Controller cluster.

Command.name: lslicense
Command.description: The lslicense command displays current license settings for cluster features.

Command.name: lsmdisk
Command.description: The lsmdisk command returns a concise list or a detailed view of managed disks (MDisks) visible to the cluster. It can also list detailed information about a single MDisk.

Command.name: lsmdiskcandidate
Command.description: The lsmdiskcandidate command lists all of the unmanaged MDisks by MDisk ID.

Command.name: lsmdiskdumps
Command.description: The lsmdiskdumps command displays a list of dumps in the /dumps/mdisk directory.

Command.name: lsmdiskextent
Command.description: The lsmdiskextent command displays the extent allocation between managed disks and virtual disks. The output lists a VDisk ID, VDisk copy ID, and the number of extents.

Command.name: lsmdiskgrp
Command.description: The lsmdiskgrp command returns a concise list or a detailed view of MDisk groups (storage pools) visible to the cluster.

Command.name: lsmdisklba
Command.description: The lsmdisklba command lists the MDisk and logical block address (LBA) for the specified VDisk LBA.

Command.name: lsmdiskmember
Command.description: The lsmdiskmember command displays a list of VDisks that are using extents on the specified MDisk. That is, the virtual disks are using extents on the managed disk that are specified by the MDisk ID.

Command.name: lsmigrate
Command.description: The lsmigrate command displays the progress of all current data migration operations.

Command.name: lsnode
Command.description: The lsnode command returns a concise list or a detailed view of nodes that are part of the cluster. The list report style can be used to obtain two styles of report: * A list containing concise information about all the nodes on a cluster. (Each entry in the list corresponds to a single node.) * The detailed information about a single node.

Command.name: lsnodecandidate
Command.description: The lsnodecandidate command lists all of the nodes that are available to add to the cluster.

Command.name: lsnodedependentvdisks
Command.description: The lsnodedependentvdisks command displays the virtual disks (VDisks) that are dependent on the status of the specified node.

Command.name: lsnodevpd
Command.description: The lsnodevpd command displays the vital product data (VPD) for each node.

Command.name: lsportip
Command.description: The lsportip command lists the iSCSI IP addresses assigned for each port on each node in the cluster.

Command.name: lsquorum
Command.description: The lsquorum command lists the managed disks (MDisks) or drives that the cluster is currently using to store quorum data.

Command.name: lsrcconsistgrp
Command.description: The lsrcconsistgrp command returns a concise list or a detailed view of Metro or Global Mirror consistency groups visible to the cluster.

Command.name: lsrcrelationship
Command.description: The lsrcrelationship command returns a concise list or a detailed view of Metro or Global Mirror relationships visible to the cluster.

Command.name: lsrcrelationshipcandidate
Command.description: The lsrcrelationshipcandidate command lists VDisks that are eligible to form Metro or Global Mirror relationships. You can list eligible VDisks that are on the local or remote cluster.

Command.name: lsrcrelationshipprogress
Command.description: You can use the lsrcrelationshipprogress command to display the progress of the background copy of a Metro Mirror or Global Mirror relationship as a percentage. When the initial background copy process for a relationship has completed, null is displayed for the progress of that relationship.

Command.name: lsrepairsevdiskcopyprogress
Command.description: The lsrepairsevdiskcopyprogress command lists the repair progress for space-efficient VDisk copies.

Command.name: lsrepairvdiskcopyprogress
Command.description: The lsrepairvdiskcopyprogress command displays the progress of mirrored VDisk (volume) repairs and validations.

Command.name: lsrmvdiskdependentmaps
Command.description: The lsrmvdiskdependentmaps command displays all FlashCopy mappings that must be stopped for the specified VDisk to be deleted.

Command.name: lsroute
Command.description: The lsroute command displays the IP routing table.

Command.name: lssevdiskcopy
Command.description: The lssevdiskcopy command lists the space-efficient copies of the specified VDisks (volumes).

Command.name: lssnmpserver
Command.description: The lssnmpserver command returns a concise list or a detailed view of SNMP servers that are configured on the cluster.

Command.name: lssoftwaredumps
Command.description: Use the lssoftwaredumps command to display a list of software packages from the /home/admin/upgrade directory.

Command.name: lssoftwareupgradestatus
Command.description: The lssoftwareupgradestatus command displays the status of a software upgrade.

Command.name: lssyslogserver
Command.description: The lssyslogserver command returns a concise list or a detailed view of syslog servers that are configured on the cluster.

Command.name: lstimezones
Command.description: The lstimezones command lists the time zones that are available on the cluster. Each timezone is assigned an ID that can be used in the svctask settimezone command to set the time zone.

Command.name: lsuser
Command.description: Use the lsuser command to display a list of the users that have been created on the cluster.

Command.name: lsusergrp
Command.description: Use the lsusergrp command to display a list of the user groups that have been created on the cluster.

Command.name: lsvdisk
Command.description: The lsvdisk command displays a concise list or a detailed view of VDisks that are recognized by the cluster.

Command.name: lsvdiskcopy
Command.description: The lsvdiskcopy command lists VDisk (volume) copy information.

Command.name: lsvdiskdependentmaps
Command.description: The lsvdiskdependentmaps command displays all FlashCopy mappings with target virtual disks (VDisks) that are dependent upon data held on the specified VDisk.

Command.name: lsvdiskextent
Command.description: The lsvdiskextent command lists the MDisk extents that are provided for the specified VDisks.

Command.name: lsvdiskfcmapcopies
Command.description: The lsvdiskfcmapcopies command displays a list of all FlashCopy mappings with a target VDisk containing a valid copy of the specified VDisk.

Command.name: lsvdiskfcmappings
Command.description: The lsvdiskfcmappings command displays a list of FlashCopy mappings to which the VDisk belongs. A VDisk can be part of up to 256 FlashCopy mappings.

Command.name: lsvdiskhostmap
Command.description: Use the lsvdiskhostmap command to list the VDisk to the host mapping. These hosts have the specified virtual disk mapped to them; the virtual disk is visible to these hosts.

Command.name: lsvdisklba
Command.description: The lsvdisklba command lists the VDisk (volume) and logical block address (LBA) for the specified MDisk LBA.

Command.name: lsvdiskmember
Command.description: The lsvdiskmember command displays a list of MDisks that are members of the specified VDisk.

Command.name: lsvdiskprogress
Command.description: The lsvdiskprogress command tracks the progress during new virtual disk formatting.

Command.name: lsvdisksyncprogress
Command.description: The lsvdisksyncprogress command displays the progress of VDisk copy synchronization.

Command.name: showtimezone
Command.description: Use the showtimezone command to display the current time zone settings for the cluster.

Command.name: applysoftware
Command.description: The applysoftware command upgrades the node to a new level of software.

Command.name: clean
Command.description: This command allows you to clean the various dumps directories on the node that is in service mode.

Command.name: cleardumps
Command.description: The cleardumps command cleans the various dump directories on the node that is in service mode.

Command.name: dumperrlog
Command.description: The dumperrlog command dumps the contents of the error log to a text file.

Command.name: exit
Command.description: The exit command exits service mode and restarts the node.

Command.name: cpfabricdumps
Command.description: Use the cpfabricdumps command to copy dump files from a node that is visible on the fabric onto the current node.

Command.name: ls2145dumps
Command.description: The ls2145dumps command lists node assert dumps and associated output files that are located in the /dumps directory.

Command.name: lsauditlogdumps
Command.description: lsauditlogdumps Use the lsauditlogdumps command to list the audit log dumps that are available on the nodes in the cluster.

Command.name: lscimomdumps
Command.description: The lscimomdumps command lists the dump files in the /dumps/cimom directory.

Command.name: lsclustervpd
Command.description: The lsclustervpd command returns the vital product data (VPD) for the cluster to which the node belonged.

Command.name: lsclustervpd
Command.description: The lsclustervpd command returns the vital product data (VPD) for the cluster to which the node belonged.

Command.name: lserrlogdumps
Command.description: The lserrlogdumps command lists the error log dump files in the /dumps/elogs directory, which are created when you run the svctask dumperrlog command.

Command.name: lsfeaturedumps
Command.description: The lsfeaturedumps command lists the dump files in the /dumps/feature directory, which are created when you run the svctask dumpinternallog command.

Command.name: lsiostatsdumps
Command.description: The lsiostatsdumps command lists the dump files in the /dumps/iostats directory, which are created when you run the svctask startstats command.

Command.name: lsiotracedumps
Command.description: The lsiotracedumps command lists the files that are located in the /dumps/iotrace directory.

Command.name: lsmdiskdumps
Command.description: The lsmdiskdumps command displays a list of dumps in the /dumps/mdisk directory.

Command.name: lsnodevpd
Command.description: The lsnodevpd command returns the vital product data (VPD) for the specified node.

Command.name: lssoftwaredumps
Command.description: The lssoftwaredumps command lists the software packages that are located in the /home/admin/upgrade directory.

Command.name: lsfabricdumps
Command.description: Use the lsfabricdumps command to list all of the files in certain directories on a specified node.

Command.name: lsfabricvpd
Command.description: Use the lsfabricvpd command to view vital product data (VPD) for a node or cluster.
